newsitem.title: USA: American Air jet turned back by bird in engine.
newsitem.headline: American Air jet turned back by bird in engine.

text.p: An American Airlines flight was forced to turn around shortly after take-off on Friday when a bird flew into one of the engines, officials said.

Airline spokesman Tim Smith said the MD-80 jet had just taken off from Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport with 51 passengers and five crew members on board when the pilot noticed a loss of power in one engine and turned the plane back for a routine landing.
There were no injuries and all the passengers were put on the next flight to La Guardia airport in New York, while mechanics checked the plane for damage.
"We found pretty strong evidence of bird parts in the outer section of the engine," Smith said. American Airlines is owned by Fort-Worth, Texas-based AMR Corp.
